SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Free Users relative to Heavy Users?
SRP.A: Free Users is {below} Heavy Users in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total user engagement rate?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Heavy Users}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total user engagement rate?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Free Users}.

VE.Q: What is Mobile Users's User Engagement Rate in 2007?
VE.A: Mobile Users's user engagement rate in 2007 is {20.19} %.

VE.Q: What is Casual Users's User Engagement Rate in 2009?
VE.A: Casual Users's user engagement rate in 2009 is {23.74} %.

VE.Q: What is Heavy Users's User Engagement Rate in 2009?

VE.Q: What are the user engagement rate of Free Users, Casual Users, and Heavy Users in 2007?
VE.A: Free Users's user engagement rate is {20.05} %, Casual Users's user engagement rate is {19.51} %, Heavy Users's user engagement rate is {22.26} %.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum User Engagement Rate in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum user engagement rate is {19.51} %.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum User Engagement Rate in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum user engagement rate is {23.74} %.

SC.Q: What is the average total User Engagement Rate?
SC.A: The average total user engagement rate is {85.08} %.

NF.Q: Which years did the total User Engagement Rate go below 83.37 %? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
Which years did the total User Engagement Rate exceed 86.14 %? Please list the years and corresponding total values.

NC.Q: Between 2008 and 2009, was the average total User Engagement Rate higher or lower than between 2007 and 2009?
NC.A: The average total user engagement rate between 2008 and 2009 was {higher} than between 2007 and 2009.

NC.Q: Between 2007 and 2009, did the total User Engagement Rate experience a larger or smaller change than between 2008 and 2009?
NC.A: The change in total user engagement rate between 2007 and 2009 was {larger} than between 2008 and 2009.

NC.Q: Between 2007 and 2009, did the total User Engagement Rate experience a larger or smaller change than between 2007 and 2008?
NC.A: The change in total user engagement rate between 2007 and 2009 was {larger} than between 2007 and 2008.

NC.Q: Was the total User Engagement Rate in 2007 higher or lower than in 2009?
NC.A: The total user engagement rate in 2007 was {lower} than in 2009.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Heavy Users} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Free Users, Mobile Users, Heavy Users, Casual Users}.
